poem:
**Spring Heralds**

Varied weather in the UK,
a revolving door of gusts and rain,
has rolled out the red carpet
for rare avian guests,
those delicate syllables unrepeatable,
etched briefly in the notepads of birdwatchers,
data folded into a shimmering cloud
of wings and pixels, a fleeting testament
to the elegance of chance.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Varied spring weather in UK brought host of rare migratory birds Spring migration is one of the highlights of the year for birdwatchers, but the quality and quantity of arrivals is always dependent on the prevailing weather conditions. For the past two decades, the British Trust for Ornithology and other conservation organisations have collected records of rare and common birds through Birdtrack, allowing birders to input their sightings via an app on their smartphone. BTO". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Varied spring weather in UK brought host of rare migratory birds Spring migration is one of the highlights of the year for birdwatchers, but the quality and quantity of arrivals is always dependent on the prevailing weather conditions. For the past two decades, the British Trust for Ornithology and other conservation organisations have collected records of rare and common birds through Birdtrack, allowing birders to input their sightings via an app on their smartphone. BTO
